intro: Pavetta nova-guineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea pavetta, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that contain several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is of interest in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
